channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 分析：保守的な計算では、1月までにメディアの雇用喪失は650人を超え、2023年1月には約983人のジャーナリズムが削減される（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Analysis: conservative calculations put media job losses at over 650 people so far in January, compared to around 983 journalism cuts in January 2023  —  Big losses at likes of Los Angeles Times, Sports Illustrated and Mediahuis Ireland in the first weeks of 2024.

item.title: テレグラフ・メディア・グループ初の女性CEO、アンナ・ジョーンズのプロフィール。右翼的タイトルの169年の歴史の中で、おそらく最も激動の時期に就任した。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
A profile of Anna Jones, Telegraph Media Group's first female CEO, who took over at possibly the most tumultuous time in the rightwing title's 169-year history  —  The first woman to lead the Telegraph Media Group has been described as ‘extraordinarily energetic, motivated and driven’

item.title: 404メディアは、ソーシャルメディアの断片化やAIスパムが発見しにくくしていることなど、Eメールで読者に直接アプローチしたい理由を概説している（Jason Koebler/404 Media）。
item.description:
Jason Koebler / 404 Media:
404 Media outlines the reasons it wants to reach readers directly via email, including social media fragmentation and AI spam making discoverability tougher  —  Join the newsletter to get the latest updates.  —  Success  —  Great!  Check your inbox and click the link.  —  Error

item.title: 2018年の閉鎖後、セルビア人DJによって復活し、現在はSEOに最適化されたAI生成のゴミで埋め尽くされている女性向けブログ「The Hairpin」を見てみよう（Kate Knibbs/Wired）
item.description:
Kate Knibbs / Wired:
A look at women's blog The Hairpin, which has been resurrected by a Serbian DJ after its 2018 shutdown and is now filled with SEO-optimized, AI-generated trash  —  Beloved women's website The Hairpin shut down in 2018.  This month it returned from the dead to churn out AI clickbait.

item.title: 新聞各社がDC記者を削減したため、地元の問題に関して議員に圧力をかけたり、議員のパフォーマンスについて読者に情報を提供したりすることができなくなった（Cameron Joseph/Columbia Journalism Review）。
item.description:
Cameron Joseph / Columbia Journalism Review:
As newspapers cut DC reporters, they can no longer pressure legislators on local issues or inform readers about their legislators' performance  —  This week sucked.  —  On Tuesday, the Los Angeles Times laid off 115 people, more than 20 percent of its total staff.

item.title: Axios、オリジナルのノンフィクション映画とテレビ番組を開発・制作する新スタジオ部門Axios Entertainmentを立ち上げ（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
Axios launches Axios Entertainment, a new studio division that will develop and produce original nonfiction films and TV shows  —  The company has projects in development with Tom Brady's Shadow Lion, Chrissy Teigen's Huntley Productions, Media Res, Guy Ritchie, Mark Wahlberg's Unrealistic Ideas, among others.

item.title: カントリー歌手のモーガン・ウォレンを含む投資家グループがField & Streamを買収し、ブランドと年2回の印刷雑誌として再出発させる計画（Joseph Hudak/Rolling Stone）
item.description:
Joseph Hudak / Rolling Stone:
A group of investors including country singer Morgan Wallen buy Field & Stream, with plans to relaunch it as a brand and biannual print magazine  —  The country stars will relaunch the hunting, fishing, and outdoors brand digitally, in print, and through a live music festival

item.title: テレグラフ・メディア・グループのニック・ヒュー最高経営責任者（CEO）が退任し、英国はUAEが支援するグループへの経営権移譲計画について2度目の調査を開始する準備を進めている（Mark Sweney/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
Telegraph Media Group CEO Nick Hugh steps down as the UK prepares to launch a second probe into plans to transfer control of the titles to a UAE-backed group  —  Nick Hugh's exit comes amid concern over Barclay family's deal to transfer control of titles  —  The chief executive of the Telegraph …

item.title: モスクワ сourt、裁判を待つWSJ記者エヴァン・ガーシュコビッチ氏の身柄拘束を2024年3月30日まで延長、ガーシュコビッチ氏は3日以内に控訴可能（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
A Moscow сourt extends the custody of WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich to March 30, 2024 as he awaits trial; Gershkovich can appeal within three days  —  A Moscow сourt extended the custody of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich by two months on Friday as he awaits trial on spying charges that he denies.

item.title: 年功序列保護をめぐるロサンゼルス・タイムズ紙とLAタイムズ・ギルドの意見の相違により、60人以上の有色人種ジャーナリストが解雇された経緯（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
How disagreements between the Los Angeles Times and the LA Times Guild over seniority protections resulted in more than 60 journalists of color being laid off  —  Disagreements between the LA Times and its Guild over seniority protections ended in more than 60 journalists of color being laid off.

item.title: ジョージ・カーリンの遺族、AIジョージ・カーリン出演のコメディ特番をめぐり著作権侵害と肖像権侵害を主張しDudesyを提訴（Winston Cho/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Winston Cho / Hollywood Reporter:
George Carlin's estate sues Dudesy over its comedy special featuring an AI George Carlin, alleging copyright infringement and right of publicity violations  —  “We have to draw a line in the sand,” says daughter Kelly Carlin, who sued creators of an hourlong special titled 'George Carlin: I'm Glad I'm Dead.'

item.title: アマゾンのプライム・ビデオでグローバル・スポーツ・ビデオ担当バイス・プレジデントを務めていたマリー・ドノヒュー氏が、ドラフトキングスのチーフ・ビジネス・グロース・オフィサーに就任。
item.description:
Deadline:
Marie Donoghue, former vice president of global sports video at Amazon's Prime Video, joins DraftKings as its chief business & growth officer  —  UPDATE: Marie Donoghue is the new Chief Business & Growth Officer at gaming company DraftKings.  —  In her new role, Donoghue will work closely …

item.title: Netflix 共同CEOのグレッグ・ピーターズ氏とのQ&A：Apple Vision Proでアプリを発表しないこと、WWEとの契約、コンテンツ戦略、広告、競争、ゲーム、バンドルなど（Ben Thompson/Stratechery）
item.description:
Ben Thompson / Stratechery:
Q&A with Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters on not launching an app on the Apple Vision Pro, the WWE deal, content strategy, ads, competition, gaming, bundles, and more  —  I am pleased to welcome Netflix Co-CEO Greg Peters for a Stratechery Interview.  Peters was named the co-CEO of Netflix …

item.title: WGAイーストがG/Oメディアを不当労働行為で告訴、G/Oメディアは進行中の交渉で「不誠実な交渉」をしていると主張（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
The WGA East files an unfair labor practice charge against G/O Media, alleging that G/O Media has been “bargaining in bad faith” in ongoing negotiations  —  The union represents creative staffers at The Onion, The A.V. Club and Deadspin who have threatened to strike if a new deal isn't reached by Jan. 31.

item.title: 全米映画監督組合は、WGAが獲得したのと同じストリーミングの残留報酬とストリーミング・プラットフォームの視聴データへのアクセスを確保したと発表（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
The Directors Guild of America says it has secured the same streaming residuals and access to streaming platform viewing data that the WGA won  —  The union informed members on Thursday that it had also improved employer contribution rates to its pension and health plans in the second and third years of its contract.
